clause.author: Brandon Kiem
clause.title: External summer glazing of a sole-occupancy unit of a Class 2 building or a Class 4 part of a building

clause-variation.deleted-text: J3D12 does not apply in NSW.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: In climate zones 1 to 7, the aggregate solar heat gain of the glazing in each storey, including any mezzanine, of a sole-occupancy unit of a Class 2 building or a Class 4 part of a building must—

ol.li: not exceed the allowance resulting from multiplying the floor area of the storey, including any mezzanine, measured within the enclosing walls, by the constant CSHGC obtained from Table J3D12a; and
be calculated in accordance with the following formula:

A 1,2,etc MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyqamaaBa aaleaacaaIXaGaaiilaiaaikdacaGGSaGaamyzaiaadshacaWGJbaa beaaaaa@3C88@ R0lGODlhKAAZAPAAAP///wAAACwAAAAAKAAZAAACT4SPqcvtD6OctNqLQcg1bC5tHwiJZGmMJ/Op a+LF76K6s4bIuW255tFq8HaeVIxnO4qGQhoM9+sofEUN8+HDAbfRUFG5tC6rmeTtjE6rMQUAIf8L TWF0aFR5cGUwMDH4BQEABwREU01UNwABE1dpbkFsbEJhc2ljQ29kZVBhZ2VzABEFVGltZXMgTmV3 IFJvbWFuABEDU3ltYm9sABEFQ291cmllciBOZXcAEQRNVCBFeHRyYQASAAghL0WPRC9BUPQQD0df QVDyHx5BUPQVD0EA9EX0JfSPQl9BAPQQD0NfQQD0j0X0Kl9I9I9BAPQQD0D0j0F/SPQQD0EqX0Rf RfRfRfRfQQ8MAQABAAECAgICAAIAAQEBAAMAAQAEAAAKAQACAINBAAMAGwAACwEAAgCIMQACAIIs AAIAiDIAAgCCLAACAINlAAIAg3QAAgCDYwAAAQEAAAAAIf8LTWF0aFR5cGUwMDP/PD94bWwgdmVy c2lvbj0iMS4wIj8+PCEtLSBNYXRoVHlwZUBUcmFuc2xhdG9yQDVANUBNYXRoTUwyIChDbGlwYm9h cmQpLnRkbEBNYXRoTUwgMi4wIChDbGlwYm9hcmQpQCAtLT48bWF0aCB4bWxucz0naHR0cDovL3d3 dy53My5vcmcvMTk5OC9NYXRoL01hdGhNTCc+PG1yb3c+PG1zdWI+PG1pPkE8L21pPjxtcm93Pjxt bj4xPC9tbj48bW8+LDwvbW8+PG1uPjI8L21uPjxtbz4sPC9tbz48bWk+ZTwvbWk+PG1pPnQ8L21p PjxtaT5jPC9taT48L21yb3c+LzwvbXN1Yj48L21yb3c+PC9tYXRoPjwhLS0gTWF0aFR5cGVARW5k QDVANUAgLS0+ACH/C01hdGhUeXBlMDAyBgkAAAAAAAA7= the area of each glazing element; and

orientation sectors must be determined in accordance with Figure 13.3.2a of the ABCB Housing Provisions; and
P/H must be determined in accordance with Figure S37C7aFigure S37C7; and
for P/H between those shown in Tables J3D12b, J3D12c, J3D12d, J3D12e, J3D12f, J3D12g, J3D12h, J3D12i and J3D12j, either use the next highest P/H or interpolate.

table-reference.title: Constant for Solar Heat Gain (CSHGC) — climate zones 1 to 7

ol.li: The ventilation opening area is the total area of each ventilation opening divided by the floor area of the storey, including any mezzanine.
No window can have a design ventilation opening greater than 90% because the window frame will always obstruct some area of the opening.
Interpolation is allowed for values between those shown.

row.entry: Room type multiplier (for bedroom and unconditioned areas) (RS)
Frame solar absorptance multiplier Frame SA = 0.3 up to 0.4 (FS)
Frame solar absorptance multiplier Frame SA = 0.4 up to 0.5 (FS)
Frame solar absorptance multiplier Frame SA = 0.5 or more (FS)
Floor factor for tiled or vinyl covered floors (HS)
Floor factor for other than tiled or vinyl covered floors (HS)
Room type multiplier (for bedroom and unconditioned areas) (RS)
Frame solar absorptance multiplier (for metal frame windows) (FS) SA ≤ 0.40
Frame solar absorptance multiplier (for metal frame windows) (FS) SA > 0.40 to < 0.68
Frame solar absorptance multiplier (for metal frame windows) (FS) SA ≥ 0.68
Floor factor for tiled or vinyl covered floors (HS)
Floor factor for other than tiled or vinyl covered floors (HS)

desc-note.p: Interpolation is allowed for values between those shown.
